main.name: Divya Raj
main.description: Full-stack engineer with a flair for perfection. Good at hacking up a solution to a problem, soliving things at scale, and picking up your local language. Talk video games to me and you're my best friend
main.bio:
I've been coding for the last 9 years, starting with C/C++, moving on to Java, and then Python and JS. I've made some cool projects as I went along, solidifying my understanding of everything I learnt. 

 I have professional experience from working at Dell and then at Goldman Sachs, which I am currently building upon as a graduate student in Software Engineering at Carnegie Mellon University. My current interests lie in scalable software systems, and how we can design, create, test and maintain them. 

I got my undergraduate degree in Computer Science from Shiv Nadar University, graduating in 2020. I have two prior internships under my belt and three of my apps are currently on the Play Store.

I've always been a fan of video games and it is in fact my love for games that got me into CS. Even though I'm much busier now, I'll always find time for a good game.... 

Along with that I enjoy reading about history and non-fiction in my free time. Recently, I've also developed an interest in learning various languages. I spend my free time honing my Korean, Spanish and Telugu. I can only get better at them :)

Contact me on any of my socials for work related stuff or just general chit chat... I'm all ears.
main.contactmessage:
Want to have a chat? 
Just write your mail down below to get in touch...

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of the tools and technologies I'm familiar with, along with my personal skill rating for them...

education.degree: Master's in Software Engineering - Scalable Systems
education.description: Will hopefully graduate as a complete software profesional, having the knowledge for delivering a software solution, front to back. Will fill this up later.

Got introduced to complex yet fundamental CS concepts like Operating Systems, DBMS, Computer Architecture, Computer Networks, Data Structures and Algorithms, Discrete Maths, Computational Theory etc. Also did a variety of other courses like Microeconomics, Complex Analysis, Data Analytics among some others.
This place gave me a platform to find like minded people and follow my true passions.

Played a big role in shaping the current me. Learnt my Computer Science ABCD here with C++. Also got started with game dev while I was here. Won a lot of Art and Craft competitions, "Just a minute" speeches, the Tech Wizard award of my school, and many more accomplishements, along with some great memories.

work.title: Full Stack Intern
work.description: Summer internship in which I worked on a full stack dashboard project, which was to be used by upper managements, in mission control rooms and in company wide all-hands meetings. Shows a high level view of all operational metrics for the entire fleet of Zoox's vehicles. First real work experience in the US, took some time to get used to the work culture here, but eventually got the hang of it.

work.title: Technical Analyst - Intern + FTE
work.description: My first full time job. Have developed both as a developer and as a professional while here. My first project involved working on adapting current data pathways according a new system we were developing. Lots of architecture analysis, python automation and a java library development in there. Followed this up by working with ReactTS to display large amounts of data efficiently and beautifully.

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.description: Summer Internship in their Bangalore office. My first corporate experience, was daunting at first but got the hang of it eventually. My work was a POC involving JWT authentication, wrapped up in Kubernetes and the service mesh called Istio. Learned a lot here, both in the tech and non-tech domains.

work.title: Android Development Intern
work.description:
A startup in Gurgaon. I worked on their new Android application "Lookup", a real estate app that automatically picks up empty properties, and suggests them to buyers.
Worked with REST APIs, Chat SDK integration, optimizing and building new UI on top of the already existing one and generally helped form a solid base for their mobile UI architecture.

projects.title: UniPool
projects.category: Android app providing a platform for students to find potential cab-poolers, which makes the cab more affordable for students.

projects.title: Actor Recognition in Movies
projects.category: Recognizing actors in a movie clip or image, using OpenCV, DeepLearning and Python.

projects.title: Wiew
projects.category: Enjoy videos in sync with your friends, while video calling them

projects.title: Postcard
projects.category: A social media app for travelers, Android+Kotlin

projects.title: ShareBear
projects.category: A sharing platform for my university. A React Native app

projects.title: Adventures Of Dynamo
projects.category: An RPG game I made back in 2013. My first game :)

projects.title: Virtual Cricket
projects.category: A C++ game simulating the classic school game of Odd-Eve cricket.

projects.title: More...
projects.category: Check out more of my projects on my github page.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Divya Raj must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
